keyword: how many calories are in a tbsp of peanut butter
title: How Many Calories in a Tablespoon of Peanut Butter?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a tbsp of peanut butter, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Tablespoon of Peanut Butter?
assumptions: Smooth, natural peanut butter; no added sugar, salt, or oils; ~16 g per tablespoon.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, ingredients (e.g., added sugar/oil), texture, and measurement. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One tablespoon of peanut butter contains about 94 kcal and 4 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a tbsp of peanut butter?
faqs.a: Approximately 94 kcal for one tablespoon of natural peanut butter.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a tbsp of peanut butter?
faqs.a: About 4 g of protein per tablespoon.

faqs.q: Does peanut butter have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 8.1 g total fat per tbsp, mostly healthy unsaturated fats.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in peanut butter per tbsp?
faqs.a: About 7 mg in natural varieties; higher in salted versions (up to 100 mg).

faqs.q: Is peanut butter keto-friendly in a tbsp serving?
faqs.a: Yes, low carbs (3.1 g total, 1.3 g fiber) make it suitable for keto.
